page.title: 10MINING PRESENT-CROSSGATES 2
page.content: Before any mining could take place, the coal seams had to be exposed. The topsoil,then the overburden were removed,being piled into{bings}which sheilded the local villages of Halbeath and Crossgates from the site. Then another natural obstacle was discovered. Over 100 feet of porous sandstone was excavated to expose the top seam.Heavy equipment was brought in _draglines,huge mechanical shovels which could swallow 15 tonnes a time, coupled with 50 tonne lorries,soon bringing production up to 13,000 tonnes a week_ soon to be expanded to 80,000 tonnes. Four seams are excavable but because of faulting,some of the coal is unobtainable. The open cast mining process can be up to 60% more efficient than shaft mining as in shaft mining there are obvious safety reasons i.e. roofing.
